prospects.name: Full Body Mobility
prospects.description: This sequence is designed to improve the range of motion throughout the body, focusing on the spine, shoulders, and hips. It combines twists, side bends, and balance poses to enhance total body flexibility and agility.

prospects.name: Peak Pose Wheel
prospects.description:
This sequence builds towards the advanced backbend, Wheel pose. To prepare for this pose, the routine focuses on mobilizing the spine and shoulders and opening up the fronts of the hips. It is best practiced when fully warmed up, with careful attention to the lower back and only moving within safe ranges of motion. For those who can practice Wheel safely, it serves as an excellent counterpose to common postures from cycling or sitting at a desk, potentially alleviating lower back, upper back, and shoulder pain. For those not yet ready for Wheel, the other poses in this sequence are also effective for addressing muscular imbalances.

​

The objectives are to increase spinal and shoulder mobility, stretch the abs, chest, and fronts of the shoulders, open up the hip flexors, activate the glutes, and help alleviate lower and upper back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Supported Bridge
- Thunderbolt—Shoulder Rolls
- Kneeling Cat-Cow
- Puppy
- Downward Facing Dog
- Cobra
- Low Lunge with Shoulder Opener
- Bridge
- Wheel
- Windscreen Wipers

prospects.name: Core Stability
prospects.description: In this Intermediate sequence, we stabilize the spine, ribs and pelvis; strengthen the deep abdominals, obliques and lower back; and activate the glutes to improve balance, help to prevent and alleviate lower back pain and enhance athletic performance. It's a great session to do in the morning or pre-workout.

prospects.name: Balance and Agility
prospects.description: Maintaining effective cycling form when you're under pressure requires substantial balance, coordination, agility, and core strength. This series will develop those capabilities so you can put down the power when it really matters.

prospects.name: Balance & Mobility
prospects.description:
This balance sequence is excellent for training balance and proprioception, while also improving overall mobility, particularly in the spine and hips. It provides a challenging workout for the quads and glutes, making it a great choice for the morning or before a workout.

​

The objectives include improving balance, proprioception, and body awareness; strengthening the knees, quads, and glutes; opening up the hips and chest; enhancing mobility in the spine; boosting focus and concentration; and practicing diaphragmatic, nasal breathing.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Mountain
- Half Sun Salutations
- High Lunge with Chest Opener
- Flying Lunge
- Warrior 3 with Chest Opener
- Chair Pose Twists
- Revolved Side Angle
- Awkward Pose
- Final Resting Pose

prospects.name: Hip Openers
prospects.description: Seeing gains from the _Hip Openers_ session? This series will build on those gains, further loosening overworked and inflexible muscles in and around the hip joints.

prospects.name: Off Balance
prospects.description:
This balance sequence starts with engaging one-legged standing postures that strengthen the feet, ankles, hips, and glutes, and concludes with a challenging Side Plank series aimed at strengthening the hips, abs, and obliques. It is an excellent routine to practice in the morning or before a workout.

​

The objectives are to improve balance, proprioception, and body awareness; strengthen the feet, ankles, hips, glutes, core, arms, and shoulders; enhance focus and concentration; and practice diaphragmatic, nasal breathing.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Mountain
- Tiptoes
- Sidebending-Tree
- Knee Hugs
- Dancer
- Side Plank Variations
- Final Resting Pose

prospects.name: Core Strengtheners I
prospects.description: The power to to put watts to the pedals comes not just from your legs, but from your core. When your core is strong and stable, you can generate more power, more efficiently. You'll also suffer less back pain. With those goals in mind, this sequence strengthens the abs, obliques, and lower back.
